GET /api.description: serves up a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /api/topics.description: serves an array of all topics

GET /api/articles.description: serves an array of all articles which can be sorted by the following queries

GET /api/articles/:article_id.description: serves an object of one article indicated by the article_id

article.title: Eight pug gifs that remind me of mitch
article.author: icellusedkars

GET /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: serves an array of comment objects indicated by the article_id

POST /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: serves a new comment object added to an article by the article_id

PATCH /api/articles/:article_id.description: serves an updated article object with new vote count

article.author: icellusedkars
article.title: Sony Vaio; or, The Laptop
article.body: Call me Mitchell. Some years ago..

DELETE /api/comments/:comment_id.description: serves a 204 status code, providing no content when request has successfully deleted comment with specified comment_id

GET /api/users.description: serves an array of user objects

GET /api/users/:username.description: serves a user object for a user specified by their username

PATCH /api/comments/:comment_id.description: serves a comment object with new vote count which is requested by the client

GET: /api/topics/:slug.description: serves a topic object specified by the topic slug

topic.description: The man, the Mitch, the legend

DELETE: /api/topics/:slug.description: serves a 204 status code, providing no content when request has successfully deleted topic

PATCH: /api/topics/:slug.description: serves a topic object with updated properties

DELETE: /api/users/:username.description: serves a 204 status code, providing no content when request has successfully deleted the user and corresponding comments and articles

PATCH: /api/users/:username.description: serves a user object that has been updated as per the client's request
